_prev_prog_3.Description: Warehousing of finished products, raw materials, and packaging.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Tedia Company Inc. holds the individual safety and health of every employee of the highest importance.  In addition to complying with all Ohio and Federal safety codes and regulations, Tedia makes all reasonable efforts to prevent work related injuries and illness.  To meet these ends, Tedia:

* Has established and is maintaining an employee Safety Team to represent all work groups.  Membership is rotating so that as many employees as possible will have an opportunity to participate in creating a safer workplace,  

* Schedules regular safety inspections.  They are conducted to discover and correct unsafe conditions and work practices.  

* Investigates every accident, injury, and near miss, regardless of its severity, with the intent of preventing similar accidents or injuries in the future because accidents and injuries represent flaws in our work processes.

* Provides suitable personal protective equipment for all employees.  PPE is available at all times and is required to be worn for designated work tasks.  



For more than 30 years, Tedia has specialized in the manufacture of high-purity laboratory and industrial chemicals for our customers around the world.  Manufacturing over 500 solvents and acids in 12 grades (including HPLC, GC, Anhydrous, Pesticide, and Bio), Tedia provides extraordinary quality and the ability to customize purification to individual customers? requirements.  Tedia routinely handles quantities ranging from 100ml to bulk tankers.  UN rated packaging used to ship products includes standard fiber board boxes and more specialized items such as septum-sealed Anhydrosolv bottles and returnable stainless steel Recycletainers.



The chemicals at Tedia covered by the EPA?s Risk Management Program are chloroform, ethyl ether, and pentane.  The maximum quantities that can be stored at this location are 100,000 pounds of chloroform, 45,000 pounds of ethyl ether, and 25,000 pounds of pentane.  These quantities are approximate values.  Chloroform i

s an EPA toxic; pentane is a flammable; ethyl ether is also a flammable.  These chemicals at this location are received in drums and stored in recycletainers and drums that may be as large as 850L in volume.  The process in this warehouse is a Program 3 process because public receptors are included within the greatest distance to endpoint indicated by the worst-case scenarios and the processes themselves fall under NAICS code 325199.



In addition to being subject to the EPA regulation, Tedia complies with OSHA PSM, as well as the RCRA and CERCLA requirements due to the large quantities of hazardous solvents stored on site.  



To meet these requirements and to ensure the safety of our employees, Tedia has, and continues to improve, a comprehensive prevention program.  All new employees receive a safety briefing before they enter the work areas.  The initial briefing is followed by in-depth training within 60-days of employment.  General Safety Rules, encompassing everything from safe lifting to proper PPE to spill cleanup procedures, are issued to all employees on their first day, and are emphad throughout their daily work. Posters throughout the facility and bulletin board postings, including daily safety and housekeeping checks, are a constant reminder to employees of their responsibility in creating a safer workplace for everyone at Tedia.  More structured safety involvement is effected through monthly safety meetings (for all employees) and the involvement of the Employee Safety Team in accident prevention activities. 



Due to Tedia's high standard in safety, there have been no releases of the regulated substances during the past five years.  



Tedia Company Inc. submits annual reports to the Butler County LEPC and SERC (the State Emergency Response Commission) listing quantities of regulated chemicals.  All facilities that report to the Butler County LEPC in this manner are included in their emergency response plans.  As part of their annual training pro

gram, Fairfield Fire Department engine companies and paramedics participate in a familiarization tour of Tedia facilities.  Due to the large quantities of hazardous chemicals stored in its facilities, Tedia employees are not required to attempt to fight fires.   Employee responsibilities in the event of a fire are to safely shut down all equipment where it can be done without jeopardizing their safety, to evacuate the building by the nearest exit, and to report to the designated rally point.  The alarm used in the Tedia production facility provides internal notification only.  In the event of a fire, the Fairfield Fire Department will be automatically notified whenever the emergency sprinkler system is activated.  As a means of preparing for such an emergency, biannual evacuation drills are held. 



Tedia believes that its safety posture can always be improved and is involved in several programs to introduce new safety systems and update existing ones. Our efforts to excel extend to all facets of safety development. 

* Training: Our Safety and Training Manager will complete the 30-hour OSHA course in General Industry Safety this year.  Monthly safety meetings will continue, as will the development of formal lesson plans and schedules for regulatory compliance training.

* * Organizational changes: The Safety Team has been established, and will take an increasingly active role as the years continue.  In addition, this team will be responsible for implementing the employee participation plans required under this act.  

* Participation:  Tedia is completing the 10 Step Plan with the Ohio Bureau of Workers's Compensation.  Because we value the safety of the community in which we live and work, Tedia has participated in the Greater Hamilton Safety Council since 2004.
